info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 16 at 2:16PM CST until February 17 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...A period of freezing rain and sleet quickly changing to wet snow expected overnight. After a break in the accumulating wintry precipitation Thursday morning, wind driven snow is expected Thursday afternoon and early evening. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze are expected. North winds gusting as high as 45 mph near Lake Michigan and 35 mph inland Thursday afternoon and early evening. * WHERE...DuPage and Northern Cook Counties. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 9 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow will reduce visibility Thursday afternoon, particularly near Lake Michigan. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and especially the evening commute on Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow combined with strong winds could put strain on tree limbs and power lines and result in some power outages.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.
